tit.cmt: 飛鳥→文意を明確にするために漢字表記しています。
tit.e: Asuka (飛鳥 in Chinese characters, the name of present-day Asuka Village, Nara Prefecture)
Asuka (飛鳥 in Chinese characters, the name of present-day Asuka Village, Nara Prefecture)

sen.j: 飛鳥（あすか）は、現在の奈良県高市郡明日香村辺りを指す地域の名。
sen.e: Asuka (飛鳥) is the name of a region located in vicinity of present day Asuka-mura (明日香村), Takaichi-gun, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 明日香村→文意を明確にするために漢字表記しています。 飛鳥→文意を明確にするために漢字表記しています。
sen.e: Asuka is the name of a region located in vicinity of present day Asuka Village, Takaichi County, Nara Prefecture.
Asuka is the name of a region located in vicinity of present day Asuka Village, Takaichi County, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 周囲を山々や丘陵に囲まれた小盆地で、その中央を飛鳥川が流れている。
sen.e: The region is a small basin encircled by mountains, slopes, and Asuka-gawa river centrally flows the small basin.
The region is a small basin encircled by mountains, slopes, and the Asuka-gawa river centrally runs the small basin.
The region is a small basin encircled by mountains, slopes, and the Asuka-gawa river centrally runs the small basin.

sen.j: 河内国（大阪府羽曳野市）の飛鳥 (河内国)（「近つ飛鳥」「河内飛鳥」）と区別するため、「遠つ飛鳥」・「大和飛鳥」と呼ばれることもある。
sen.e: To differentiate it from Asuka of Kawachi Province (Habikino City, Osaka Prefecture) (`Chikatsu-Asuka' `Kawachiasuka'), it is sometimes called `Totsu Atsuka' or `Yamatoatsuka.'
To differentiate it from Asuka of Kawachi Province (Habikino City, Osaka Prefecture) (also known as 'Chikatsu-Asuka' 'Kawachiasuka'), it is sometimes called 'Totsu Asuka' or 'Yamato Asuka.'
To differentiate it from Asuka of Kawachi Province (Habikino City, Osaka Prefecture) (also known as 'Chikatsu-Asuka' 'Kawachiasuka'), it is sometimes called 'Totsu Asuka' or 'Yamato Asuka.'

sen.j: 遠つ飛鳥は、奈良盆地の東南の飛鳥を指すと考えられている。
sen.e: It is considered that Totsuatsuka refers to Asuka in the eastern south of Nara Basin.
It is considered that Totsu Asuka refers to Asuka in the eastern south of Nara Basin.
It is considered that Totsu Asuka refers to Asuka in the eastern south of Nara Basin.

sen.j: 古い時代においてのみ公的であった名称ではない。
sen.e: It is not a name which was officially used only in the ancient time.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It is not a name which was officially used only in the ancient time.
It is not a name which was officially used only in the ancient time.

sen.j: 近年においても1956年の市町村合併によって明日香村が生まれるまでは、この地域に飛鳥村があり地方自治体の名称として飛鳥は存在した。
sen.e: In recent years, Asuka (飛鳥) existed as a name of a local government unit, Asuka-mura village (飛鳥村) in this region, until Asuka-mura village (明日香村) was established after the municipal merger in 1956.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。 飛鳥村→文意を明確にするために漢字表記しています。明日香村→文意を明確にするために漢字表記しています。
sen.e: In recent years, Asuka existed as a name of a local government unit, Asuka Village (飛鳥村) in this region, until Asuka Village (明日香村) was established after the municipal merger in 1956.
In recent years, Asuka existed as a name of a local government unit, Asuka Village (飛鳥村) in this region, until Asuka Village (明日香村) was established after the municipal merger in 1956.

sen.j: また、現在においても明日香村の字（あざ）として飛鳥という地域名称は存在している。
sen.e: Today, the regional name, Asuka (飛鳥) as a regional name still exists as aza of Asuka-mura village (明日香村).
sen.cmt: 字（あざ）→定訳不明のため→aza とスペルアウトしています。明日香村→文意を明確にするために漢字表記しています。 飛鳥村→文意を明確にするために漢字表記しています。
sen.e: Today, the regional name, Asuka (飛鳥) as a regional name still exists as aza (an administrative designation of small sections into which some of the rural districts of Japan are divided) of Asuka-mura village (明日香村).

Today, the regional name, Asuka (飛鳥) as a regional name still exists as aza (an administrative designation of small sections into which some of the rural districts of Japan are divided) of Asuka-mura village (明日香村).

sen.j: しかし、「飛鳥」といった場合にはこちら（大阪府の飛鳥）の意味ではなく、冒頭の意味（奈良県の飛鳥）であることが一般的である。
sen.e: However, it is common that `Asuka' (飛鳥) refers to the Asuka of Nara Prefecture, not referring to Asuka of Osaka Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 飛鳥→文意を明確にするために漢字表記しています。
sen.e: However, it is common that 'Asuka' (飛鳥) refers to the Asuka of Nara Prefecture, not referring to Asuka of Osaka Prefecture, mentioned at the beginning.
However, it is common that 'Asuka' (飛鳥) refers to the Asuka of Nara Prefecture, not referring to Asuka of Osaka Prefecture, mentioned at the beginning.

sen.j: 「あすか」の語源については外来語由来説、地形名称由来説などがあるがはっきりとしたことは判っていない。
sen.e: It is not clear about the word origin of `Asuka,' though there are a few theories including the theory that the word came from abroad, and the theory that the word is based on the topography.
It is not clear about the word origin of 'Asuka,' though there are a few theories including the theory that the word came from abroad, and the theory that the word is based on the topography.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変えました。
sen.e: It is not clear about the word origin of 'Asuka,' though there are a few theories including the theory that the word came from abroad, and the theory that the word is based on the topography.

sen.j: 『万葉集』に「飛ぶ鳥の」歌がいくつか見える。
sen.e: "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves) contains a few waka that begin with `tobutorino' (飛ぶ鳥の) (a flying bird).
sen.cmt: 飛ぶ鳥の→文意を明確にするために漢字表記しています。
sen.e: "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves) contains a few waka that begin with 'tobu torino' (飛ぶ鳥の; a flying bird).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを等を変えました。
sen.e: "Manyoshu" (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves) contains a few waka that begin with 'tobu torino' (飛ぶ鳥の; a flying bird).

sen.j: 飛鳥（とぶとり）の 明日香の里を置きて去（い）なば君が辺は見えずかもあらむ(1-78)
sen.e: 飛鳥(とぶとり)の 明日香の里を置きて去(い)なば君が辺は見えずかもあらむ(1-80)
sen.cmt: 意味解釈が困難なため訳出できず。
sen.e: Tobu tori no Asuka no sato wo Okite inaba Kimi ga atari wa Miezu ka mo aramu (If I depart and leave behind, the village of Asuka, where the birds fly, I shall no longer be able to see the place where you abide) (1-78)
sen.cmt: 数値修正しました。英訳は、以下サイトより引用しました。http://books.google.co.jp/books?id=Zk4EucRlvSwC&pg=PA263&dq=tobutori+no+asuka+sato+okite&hl=ja&ei=zTpHTL2CEoe8vgO9ypyqBQ&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CC8Q6AEwAA#v=onepage&q&f=false
sen.e: Tobu tori no Asuka no sato wo Okite inaba Kimi ga atari wa Miezu ka mo aramu (If I depart and leave behind, the village of Asuka, where the birds fly, I shall no longer be able to see the place where you abide) (1-78)

sen.j: 飛鳥の 明日香の河の上ッ瀬に生（お）ふる玉藻は下ッ瀬に流れ触らふ玉藻なす（略）(2-194)
sen.e: 飛鳥の 明日香の河の上ッ瀬に生(お)ふる玉藻は下ッ瀬に流れ触らふ玉藻なす(略)(2-196)
sen.cmt: 意味解釈が困難なため訳出できず。
sen.e: Tobu tori no Asukano kawa no Kamitsuse ni Ouru Tamamo ha Shimotsuse ni nagare furau Tamamo nasu (In the River of Asuka, the gemweed growing along the upper shallows are touching each other by swinging in the flow toward lower shallows)(omitted)(2-194)
sen.cmt: 数値修正しました。英訳は以下サイトを参考に補足しました。http://wiki.livedoor.jp/towaco964/d/%A1%DA2-194%A1%DB%A1%A1%C8%F4%C4%BB%A1%A1%CC%C0%C6%FC%B9%E1%C7%B5%B2%CF%C7%B7
sen.e: Tobu tori no Asukano kawa no Kamitsuse ni Ouru Tamamo ha Shimotsuse ni nagare furau Tamamo nasu (In the River of Asuka, the gemweed growing along the upper shallows are touching each other by swinging in the flow toward lower shallows)(omitted)(2-194)

sen.j: 飛鳥の 明日香の川の上ッ瀬に石橋渡し下ッ瀬に打橋渡す石橋に生ひ靡（なび）ける（略）(2-194)
sen.e: 飛鳥の 明日香の川の上ッ瀬に石橋渡し下ッ瀬に打橋渡す石橋に生ひ靡(なび)ける(略)(2-196)
sen.cmt: 意味解釈が困難なため訳出できず。
sen.e: Tobu tori no Asuka no kawa no kamitsuse ni Ishibashi watashi shimotsuse ni uchihashi watasu ishibashi ni oinabikeru (On the Asuka River, where the birds fly, in the upper shoals there is a bridge of stone, and in the lower shoals a bridge of wood: The gem weed that grows on the bridge of stone) (omitted) (2-194)
sen.cmt: 数値を修正しました。英訳は、以下サイトより引用しました。http://books.google.co.jp/books?id=LsHfIsIXgEgC&pg=PA86&lpg=PA86&dq=tobutori+no+asuka&source=bl&ots=v0q2pwgtuT&sig=xKkRdKARFksupoKXmKD399Crs4M&hl=ja&ei=djlHTJyxGo6GvAPqvaXFAg&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=3&ved=0CB8Q6AEwAg#v=onepage&q=tobutori%20no%20asuka&f=false
sen.e: Tobu tori no Asuka no kawa no kamitsuse ni Ishibashi watashi shimotsuse ni uchihashi watasu ishibashi ni oinabikeru (On the Asuka River, where the birds fly, in the upper shoals there is a bridge of stone, and in the lower shoals a bridge of wood: The gem weed that grows on the bridge of stone) (omitted) (2-194)

sen.j: 「飛鳥」を「飛ぶ鳥」と読ませ、「明日香」の枕詞となっていることがわかる。
sen.e: `Asuka' (飛鳥) is read `tobutori' (飛ぶ鳥) (a flying bird), and it is a pillow word of `Asuka' (明日香).
Asuka' (飛鳥) is read as 'tobu tori' (飛ぶ鳥) (a flying bird), and it is a Makura kotoba (a set epithet) of 'Asuka' (明日香).
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを変え、用語を変更しました。
sen.e: Asuka' (飛鳥) is read as 'tobu tori' (飛ぶ鳥) (a flying bird), and it is a Makura kotoba (a set epithet) of 'Asuka' (明日香).

sen.j: 飛鳥の地に鳥類が多く飛んできたことと名称が関係があると思われる。
sen.e: It seems that it has connections with that many birds came to Asuka.
It seems that it has connections with that many birds came to Asuka.
It seems that it has connections with that many birds came to Asuka.

sen.j: 現在では明日香村一帯、あるいは人によってはその近隣までも含んで飛鳥と指し示すこともある。
sen.e: Today, the entire Asuka-mura village is referred to as Asuka, and some people refer to the region which even includes the neighborhood of Asuka as Asuka.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Today, the entire Asuka Village is referred to as Asuka, and some people refer to the region which even includes the neighborhood of Asuka.
Today, the entire Asuka Village is referred to as Asuka, and some people refer to the region which even includes the neighborhood of Asuka.

sen.j: 飛鳥時代当時はより狭い地域を示すものであったようである。
sen.e: It seems that in the Nara Period, Asuka refers to a narrower region.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It seems that in the Nara period, Asuka refers to a narrower region.
It seems that in the Nara period, Asuka refers to a narrower region.

sen.j: 飛鳥盆地を中心として飛鳥川の東側に当たるあまり広くないところ（平地に限れば南北1.6キロ、東西0.8キロほど）と考えられていた（岸俊男など）。
sen.e: It was considered that Asuka was the area mainly located in Asuka Basin and Asuka was not so large and was along the east side of Asuka-gawa River (its flatland is equivalent to the area, 1.6 Kilometers from south to north, 0.8 Kilometers from east to west) (According to Toshio KISHI).

It was considered that it was not so large area mainly located in Asuka Basin and the east of the Asuka-gawa River (its flatland was equivalent to the area, 1.6 kilometers from the north to south, 0.8 Kilometers from east to west) (by Toshio KISHI, and so on).

It was considered that it was not so large area mainly located in Asuka Basin and the east of the Asuka-gawa River (its flatland was equivalent to the area, 1.6 kilometers from the north to south, 0.8 Kilometers from east to west) (by Toshio KISHI, and so on).

tit.e: Asuka no miyako (the capital of Asuka)
Asuka no miyako (the capital of Asuka)
Asuka no miyako (the capital of Asuka)

sen.j: この飛鳥には、天皇（大王 (ヤマト王権)）の宮が置かれたことが多い。
sen.e: Imperial palaces (King [Yamato Dynasty]) were established in this Asuka many times.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Imperial palaces of the emperors (King [Yamato Dynasty]) were established in this Asuka many times.
Imperial palaces of the emperors (King [Yamato Dynasty]) were established in this Asuka many times.

sen.j: 推古天皇が崇峻5年（592年）の豊浦宮（とゆらのみや）での即位から持統天皇8年（694年）の藤原京への移転までの、約100年間を日本史時代区分表として飛鳥時代と称している。
sen.e: About 100 years, from when Emperor Suiko ascended the throne at Toyura no miya Imperial residence in 592, till when the palace of Emperor Jito was transferred to Fujiwara-kyo (the Fujiwara Palace; the ancient capital of Fujiwara) in 694, was categorized as and referred to as the Asuka Period in the Japanese historical period table.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: About 100 years, from when Emperor Suiko ascended the throne at Toyura no miya Imperial residence in 592, until when Emperor Jito transferred to Fujiwara-kyo (the Fujiwara Palace; the ancient capital of Fujiwara) in 694, was called the Asuka period in the Japanese historical period table.

About 100 years, from when Emperor Suiko ascended the throne at Toyura no miya Imperial residence in 592, until when Emperor Jito transferred to Fujiwara-kyo (the Fujiwara Palace; the ancient capital of Fujiwara) in 694, was called the Asuka period in the Japanese historical period table.

sen.j: また、長らく日本の政治・文化の中心地であったので、宮殿や豪族の邸宅などが建ち並びんだ。
sen.e: Asuka has been the center of politics and culture in Japan, and there were a number of palaces or residences of Gozoku (local ruling family).
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Asuka has been the center of politics and culture in Japan for a long period, and there were a number of palaces or residences of Gozoku (local ruling family).
Asuka has been the center of politics and culture in Japan for a long period, and there were a number of palaces or residences of Gozoku (local ruling family).

sen.j: 帰化系の人々も段々と付近に居住するようになり、中でも後に有力氏族に成長したの東漢氏が、早くから飛鳥に近い檜隈に居を構えていた。
sen.e: Naturalized citizens gradually started to live in the vicinity of Asuka, and the Yamatonoaya clan, which later became a powerful clan, established their residence in Hinokuma close to Asuka from early on.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Naturalized citizens gradually started to live in the vicinity of Asuka, and the Yamatonoaya clan, which later became a powerful clan, established their residence in Hinokuma close to Asuka from early on.

Naturalized citizens gradually started to live in the vicinity of Asuka, and the Yamatonoaya clan, which later became a powerful clan, established their residence in Hinokuma close to Asuka from early on.

sen.j: 6世紀中葉には、飛鳥周辺に仏教が伝わって来て、文化の高い所となってきた。
sen.e: In the middle of the sixth century, Buddhism was introduced in Asuka and it made Asuka become a culturally sophisticated place.
In the middle of the sixth century, Buddhism was introduced in Asuka which made Asuka become a culturally sophisticated place.
In the middle of the sixth century, Buddhism was introduced in Asuka which made Asuka become a culturally sophisticated place.

sen.j: 7世紀には、飛鳥は古代日本の政治と文化の中心地となり、都市機能の整備が行われるなど、宮都の様相を呈していたので、「飛鳥京」とも呼ばれていた（『紀』）。
sen.e: In the seventh century, Asuka became a central place of politics and culture in ancient Japan, and it is called `Asuka no miyako' (the capital of Asuka) as it took on the character of a capital with city functions developed ("Ki").

In the seventh century, Asuka became a central place of politics and culture in ancient Japan, and it is called 'Asuka no miyako' as it took on the character of a capital with city functions developed ("Ki" [also known as "Nihonshoki," or Chronicles of Japan]).

In the seventh century, Asuka became a central place of politics and culture in ancient Japan, and it is called 'Asuka no miyako' as it took on the character of a capital with city functions developed ("Ki" [also known as "Nihonshoki," or Chronicles of Japan]).

tit.j: 飛鳥におかれた天皇（大王）の宮一覧
tit.e: The list of imperial palaces (king) placed in Asuka.
The list of imperial palaces (king) placed in Asuka
tit.cmt: ピリオド削除しました。
tit.e: The list of imperial palaces (king) placed in Asuka

sen.j: 豊浦宮
sen.e: Toyura no miya Imperial residence
Toyura no Miya Palace
Toyura no Miya Palace

sen.j: 小墾田宮
sen.e: Oharida Palace
Oharida no Miya Palace
Oharida no Miya Palace

sen.j: 岡本宮（飛鳥岡本宮）
sen.e: Okamoto Palace (Asuka Okamoto no miya Imperial residence)
Okamoto no Miya Palace (also known as Asuka Okamono no Miya, an ancient Imperial Palace where Emperor Jomei lived)
Okamoto no Miya Palace (also known as Asuka Okamono no Miya, an ancient Imperial Palace where Emperor Jomei lived)

sen.j: 板蓋宮
sen.e: Itabuki no Miya palace
Itabuki no Miya Palace
Itabuki no Miya Palace

sen.j: 川原宮
sen.e: Kawahara no Miya (Kawahara Palace)
Kawahara no Miya Palace
Kawahara no Miya Palace

sen.j: 岡本宮（後飛鳥岡本宮）
sen.e: Okamoto Palace (Asuka Okamoto no miya Imperial residence)
Okamoto Palace (also known as Nochi no Asuka no Okamoto no Miya, an ancient Imperial Palace where Empress Saimei lived)
Okamoto Palace (also known as Nochi no Asuka no Okamoto no Miya, an ancient Imperial Palace where Empress Saimei lived)

sen.j: 飛鳥浄御原宮
sen.e: Asuka Kiyohara no miya Imperial residence
Asuka no Kiyomihara no Miya Palace
Asuka no Kiyomihara no Miya Palace

sen.j: 飛鳥時代には、豊浦宮は飛鳥の西方、飛鳥川を挟んだ対岸にあり、小墾田宮は飛鳥の北側の小墾田（小治田）と称される地域にあったとされている。
sen.e: It is said that in the Asuka period, Toyura no miya Imperial residence was located to the west of Asuka, was on the other side of Asuka across the Asuka-gawa river, and Oharida Palace was in the region called Oharida (Owarida) to the north of Asuka.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It is said that in the Asuka period, Toyura no Miya Palace was located to the west of Asuka, was on the other side across the Asuka-gawa River, and Oharida no Miya Palace was in the region called Oharida (also known as Owarida) to the north of Asuka.

It is said that in the Asuka period, Toyura no Miya Palace was located to the west of Asuka, was on the other side across the Asuka-gawa River, and Oharida no Miya Palace was in the region called Oharida (also known as Owarida) to the north of Asuka.

sen.j: その意味では厳密には飛鳥におかれた宮ではない。
sen.e: In that sense, strictly speaking, it is not the palace established in Asuka.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In that sense, strictly speaking, they were not the palaces established in Asuka.
In that sense, strictly speaking, they were not the palaces established in Asuka.

sen.j: 豊浦宮は豪族の邸宅を利用していたと推定されている。
sen.e: It is assumed that the mansion of Gozoku (local ruling family) was used for Toyura no miya Imperial residence.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It is assumed that the mansion of Gozoku (local ruling family) was used for Toyura no Miya Palace.
It is assumed that the mansion of Gozoku (local ruling family) was used for Toyura no Miya Palace.

sen.j: 隋の使者が往来するようになると小墾田宮を造営した。
sen.e: After envoys from Sui Dynasty came back and forth, Oharida Palace was built.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: After envoys from Sui Dynasty came back and forth, Oharida no Miya Palace was built.
After envoys from Sui Dynasty came back and forth, Oharida no Miya Palace was built.

sen.j: 603年推古天皇が遷宮している。
sen.e: In 603, it was transferred by Emperor Suiko.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In 603, it was transferred by Emperor Suiko.
In 603, it was transferred by Emperor Suiko.

sen.j: これは、外国の使者の饗応に相応しい宮殿が必要になったのだろうと推測されている。
sen.e: This is probably because a palace adequate to treat envoys from abroad was required.
This is probably because a palace adequate to treat envoys from abroad was required.
This is probably because a palace adequate to treat envoys from abroad was required.

sen.j: また、古事記に記される允恭天皇の遠飛鳥宮、日本書紀に記される顕宗天皇の近飛鳥八釣宮もこの地におかれたものと解されることが多い。
sen.e: In addition, it is often understood that Totsuasuka palace of Emperor Ingyo stated in Kojiki (The Records of Ancient Matters) and Chikatsu Asuka no Yatsuri no Miya (the Yatsuri Palace at Chikatsu Asuka) of Emperor Kenzo stated in Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan) were established in Asuka.

In addition, it is often understood that Totsuasuka no Miya Palace of Emperor Ingyo stated in Kojiki (The Records of Ancient Matters) and Chikatsu Asuka no Yatsuri no Miya Palace of Emperor Kenzo stated in Nihonshoki were established in Asuka.

In addition, it is often understood that Totsuasuka no Miya Palace of Emperor Ingyo stated in Kojiki (The Records of Ancient Matters) and Chikatsu Asuka no Yatsuri no Miya Palace of Emperor Kenzo stated in Nihonshoki were established in Asuka.

sen.j: 雄略天皇（418年-479年）が初瀬を皇居とした後、用明天皇代（585年-587年）を期に飛鳥へと遷都される。
sen.e: After Emperor Yuryaku (418-479) placed the imperial palace in Hatsuse, Emperor Yomei (585-587) moved to Asuka.
After Emperor Yuryaku (418 - 479) placed the imperial palace in Hatsuse, in the era of Emperor Yomei (585 - 587) the capital was transferred to Asuka.
After Emperor Yuryaku (418 - 479) placed the imperial palace in Hatsuse, in the era of Emperor Yomei (585 - 587) the capital was transferred to Asuka.

sen.j: 最初の朝廷が開かれたのもこの飛鳥である。
sen.e: It is Asuka where the first imperial palace was placed
It is Asuka where the first Imperial Court was placed.
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせ、ピリオドを補足しました。
sen.e: It is Asuka where the first Imperial Court was placed.
